snippet: Law Department officials emphasized that the amounts being paid remain available to those who file a Freedom of Information request or inquire.
abstract: New York City Law Department has quietly adopted practice of withholding from public filings how much it pays to settle most federal court cases filed against the city or its employees; emphasizes that amounts will remain available to those who file a Freedom of Information request.
lead_paragraph: Law Department officials emphasized that the amounts being paid remain available to those who file a Freedom of Information request or inquire.

headline.seo: New York City No Longer Discloses Cost of Federal Court Settlements
headline.main: City Is No Longer Reporting the Costs of Its Settlements of Federal Cases
headline.print_headline: City Is No Longer Reporting the Costs of Its Settlements of Federal Cases
